00032 //========================================================================
00033 //
00034 // String manipulation routines
00035 //
00036 // Not described in the book, but very useful for printing multiline text
00037 // Used in ..\Win32\Fonts.cpp
00038 //========================================================================

00040 
00041 #include "GameCodeStd.h"
00042 void RemoveFirstLine(std::wstring &src, std::wstring &result)
00043 {
00044         int breakPosition = (int)src.find('\n');
00045         result = _T("");
00046         if(breakPosition != std::string.npos)   //if found...
00047         {
00048                 int len = (int)src.length();
00049                 result = src.substr(0, breakPosition);
00050                 src = src.substr(breakPosition+1, (len-breakPosition)-1);               // skip the '/n'
00051         }
00052         else
00053         {
00054                 result = src;
00055                 src = _T("");
00056         }
00057 }
00058 
00059 
00060 // Remove all leading whitespace
00061 void TrimLeft(std::wstring &s)
00062 {
00063         // find first non-space character
00064         int i = 0;
00065         int len = (int)s.length();
00066         while( i <  len )
00067         {
00068                 TCHAR ch = s[i];                        
00069                 int white = 
00070                 #ifdef UNICODE
00071                                 iswspace( ch );
00072                 #else
00073                                 isspace( ch );
00074                 #endif
00075                 if (!white)
00076                         break;
00077                 ++i;
00078         }
00079 
00080         if (i<len)
00081                 s = s.substr(i);
00082 }
00083 
00084 
00085 int CountLines(const std::wstring &s)
00086 {
00087         int lines = 0;
00088         int breakPos = 0;
00089 
00090         do 
00091         {
00092                 ++lines;
00093                 breakPos = (int)s.find('\n', breakPos+1);
00094         } while (breakPos != std::string.npos);
00095 
00096         return lines;
00097 }

00104 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00105 // Name: AnsiToWideCch()
00106 // Desc: This is a UNICODE conversion utility to convert a CHAR string into a
00107 //       WCHAR string. 
00108 //       cchDestChar is the size in TCHARs of wstrDestination.  Be careful not to 
00109 //       pass in sizeof(strDest) 
00110 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00111 HRESULT AnsiToWideCch( WCHAR* wstrDestination, const CHAR* strSource, 
00112                                      int cchDestChar )
00113 {
00114     if( wstrDestination==NULL || strSource==NULL || cchDestChar < 1 )
00115         return E_INVALIDARG;
00116 
00117     int nResult = MultiByteToWideChar( CP_ACP, 0, strSource, -1, 
00118                                        wstrDestination, cchDestChar );
00119     wstrDestination[cchDestChar-1] = 0;
00120     
00121     if( nResult == 0 )
00122         return E_FAIL;
00123     return S_OK;
00124 }
00125 
00126 
00127 
00128 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00129 // Name: WideToAnsi()
00130 // Desc: This is a UNICODE conversion utility to convert a WCHAR string into a
00131 //       CHAR string. 
00132 //       cchDestChar is the size in TCHARs of strDestination
00133 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00134 HRESULT WideToAnsiCch( CHAR* strDestination, const WCHAR* wstrSource, 
00135                                      int cchDestChar )
00136 {
00137     if( strDestination==NULL || wstrSource==NULL || cchDestChar < 1 )
00138         return E_INVALIDARG;
00139 
00140     int nResult = WideCharToMultiByte( CP_ACP, 0, wstrSource, -1, strDestination, 
00141                                        cchDestChar*sizeof(CHAR), NULL, NULL );
00142     strDestination[cchDestChar-1] = 0;
00143     
00144     if( nResult == 0 )
00145         return E_FAIL;
00146     return S_OK;
00147 }
00148

00151 
00152 
00153 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00154 // Name: GenericToAnsi()
00155 // Desc: This is a UNICODE conversion utility to convert a TCHAR string into a
00156 //       CHAR string. 
00157 //       cchDestChar is the size in TCHARs of strDestination
00158 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00159 HRESULT GenericToAnsiCch( CHAR* strDestination, const TCHAR* tstrSource, 
00160                                            int cchDestChar )
00161 {
00162     if( strDestination==NULL || tstrSource==NULL || cchDestChar < 1 )
00163         return E_INVALIDARG;
00164 
00165 #ifdef _UNICODE
00166     return WideToAnsiCch( strDestination, tstrSource, cchDestChar );
00167 #else
00168     strncpy( strDestination, tstrSource, cchDestChar );
00169     strDestination[cchDestChar-1] = '\0';
00170     return S_OK;
00171 #endif   
00172 }
00173

00177 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00178 // Name: GenericToWide()
00179 // Desc: This is a UNICODE conversion utility to convert a TCHAR string into a
00180 //       WCHAR string. 
00181 //       cchDestChar is the size in TCHARs of wstrDestination.  Be careful not to 
00182 //       pass in sizeof(strDest) 
00183 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00184 HRESULT GenericToWideCch( WCHAR* wstrDestination, const TCHAR* tstrSource, 
00185                                            int cchDestChar )
00186 {
00187     if( wstrDestination==NULL || tstrSource==NULL || cchDestChar < 1 )
00188         return E_INVALIDARG;
00189 
00190 #ifdef _UNICODE
00191     wcsncpy( wstrDestination, tstrSource, cchDestChar );
00192     wstrDestination[cchDestChar-1] = L'\0';
00193     return S_OK;
00194 #else
00195     return AnsiToWideCch( wstrDestination, tstrSource, cchDestChar );
00196 #endif    
00197 }

00200 
00201 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00202 // Name: AnsiToGeneric()
00203 // Desc: This is a UNICODE conversion utility to convert a CHAR string into a
00204 //       TCHAR string. 
00205 //       cchDestChar is the size in TCHARs of tstrDestination.  Be careful not to 
00206 //       pass in sizeof(strDest) on UNICODE builds
00207 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00208 HRESULT AnsiToGenericCch( TCHAR* tstrDestination, const CHAR* strSource, 
00209                                            int cchDestChar )
00210 {
00211     if( tstrDestination==NULL || strSource==NULL || cchDestChar < 1 )
00212         return E_INVALIDARG;
00213         
00214 #ifdef _UNICODE
00215     return AnsiToWideCch( tstrDestination, strSource, cchDestChar );
00216 #else
00217     strncpy( tstrDestination, strSource, cchDestChar );
00218     tstrDestination[cchDestChar-1] = '\0';
00219     return S_OK;
00220 #endif    
00221 }

00227 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00228 // Name: AnsiToGeneric()
00229 // Desc: This is a UNICODE conversion utility to convert a WCHAR string into a
00230 //       TCHAR string. 
00231 //       cchDestChar is the size in TCHARs of tstrDestination.  Be careful not to 
00232 //       pass in sizeof(strDest) on UNICODE builds
00233 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00234 HRESULT WideToGenericCch( TCHAR* tstrDestination, const WCHAR* wstrSource, 
00235                                            int cchDestChar )
00236 {
00237     if( tstrDestination==NULL || wstrSource==NULL || cchDestChar < 1 )
00238         return E_INVALIDARG;
00239 
00240 #ifdef _UNICODE
00241     wcsncpy( tstrDestination, wstrSource, cchDestChar );
00242     tstrDestination[cchDestChar-1] = L'\0';    
00243     return S_OK;
00244 #else
00245     return WideToAnsiCch( tstrDestination, wstrSource, cchDestChar );
00246 #endif
00247 }
